WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex issues and suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some issues and feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
Defining several properties in a class definition using get and set clauses  after compilation results in several Object.defineProperty clauses. Java Script files are getting bloated, when the class uses many such properties.
Rather than using Object.defineProperty javascript function, it could be more efficient to use Object.defineProperties(object, descriptors) function and combine several property definitions in one property descriptor.
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff800817%28v=vs.94%29.aspx
WorkItem.Summary: Get and Set properties generate excessive JS code

Comments.Message: Object.defineProperties seems less supported in browser then Object.defineProperty so i think it is better to have multiple calls

@TobiasHei - i think it is supported in all browsers those comply with ES5.
I
